title: Carol Vorderman displays her showstopping curves at the Rugby World Cup
text:
She's one of Britain's best loved television stars.

And Carol Vorderman looked sensational as she enjoyed the Wales vs Uruguay match in Japan on Sunday.

The Countdown star, 58, displayed her famous curves in a pair of skintight black jeans while she cinched her waist with a matching belt.

Stunning: Carol Vorderman, 58, looked sensational as she enjoyed the Wales vs Uruguay match in Japan on Sunday

Carol also sported a fitted Welsh jersey for the day while she let her blonde locks fall loose down her shoulders.

Adding height to her frame with a pair of black boots, Carol completed her look with a pair of sunglasses.

Checking her phone as the match went on, Carol cut a casual figure as she turned around and took in the large crowd gathered for the game.

Speaking previously on ITV's Lorraine, the in-shape star revealed the secret to her curves, choosing hiking as her favourite exercise.

Beauty: The Countdown star displayed her famous curves in a pair of skintight black jeans while she cinched her waist with a matching belt

The keen walker treks 12-20 miles twice a week, adding that she also likes to focus on her famous derriere.

'In terms of squats, or the equivalent of squats, I probably do over 20,000 a year... that's a lot,' she said.

Carol admitted that while she keeps in shape she doesn't focus on numbers on the scale, confessing she hasn't weighed herself since 1999. 'I don't actually know how much I weigh and I don't care because I go on my dress size, thank god for lycra!'

Event: Carol also sported a fitted Welsh jersey for the day while she let her blonde locks fall loose down her shoulders

'I'm probably about a size 8 to 9 at the moment. I've always had a small waist, I think I'm about 25 inches around my waist.'

'If I put on a bit of weight, I know I have, and I go up to a size 11. A larger size 10, that's kind of my boundary for where I'm happy.'

Carol has previously downplayed discussion of her famous derriere and has denied accusations she has had it surgically enhanced.

Style: Adding height to her frame with a pair of black boots, Carol completed her look with a pair of sunglasses

In a past interview with MailOnline, she said: 'I’ve always had a huge a**e. I promise I haven’t had bottom implants. It’s the same old bottom.'

'In my family, loads of us have it: the Vorderman A**e. My daughter Katie has it. My nephew has it. We’re all sticky-out-bottom people.

‘And I’ve been working out for decades, so the shape of mine is down to years of keeping fit.

‘I walk seven miles a day and I try to do a 15-mile walk once a week as well, up the Brecon Beacons or along the River Cam. It makes me so happy.'
